abstract.text: Information about a real-world surface found by examining a point on the screen.

inlineContent.text: If you use SceneKit or SpriteKit as your renderer, you can search for real-world surfaces at a screen point using:
Otherwise, you can search the camera image for real-world content using the
method. Because a frame is independent of a view, for this method you pass a point specified in normalized image coordinates (where
is the top left corner of the image and
All these methods return an array of
objects describing the content found. The number and order of results in the array depends on the search types you specify and the order you specify them in. For example, consider the code below:
call searches first for plane anchors already present in the session (according to the session configuration’s
settings); returning any such results (in order of distance from the camera) as the first elements in the array. This call also (due to the
request) attempts to determine whether the hit test ray intersects any horizontal surface not already found by plane detection, and returns that result (if any) as the last element in the array.

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
A video image captured as part of a session with position-tracking information.
Searches for real-world objects or AR anchors in the captured camera image.
Information about a real-world surface found by examining a point on the screen.
Possible types for specifying a hit-test search, or for the result of a hit-test search.
A point on a real-world planar surface detected during the search, whose orientation is perpendicular to gravity.
The anchor representing the detected surface, if any.
The distance, in meters, from the camera to the detected surface.
The position and orientation of the result relative to the nearest anchor or feature point.
The kind of detected feature the search result represents.
The position and orientation of the result relative to the world coordinate system.
A view that blends virtual 3D content from SceneKit into your augmented reality experience.
Searches for real-world objects or AR anchors in the captured camera image corresponding to a point in the SceneKit view.
A view that blends virtual 2D content from SpriteKit into the 3D space of an augmented reality experience.
Searches for real-world objects or AR anchors in the captured camera image corresponding to a point in the SpriteKit view.
The configuration’s plane detection options.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
